ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: It's a great class for anyone interested in the theory behind art.
I would definitely recommend this course to another student. Prof. Casetti is extremely flexible and allows the student to develop their final paper in their own mode of inquiry, etc.
Yes, I thought it was a good course.
Yes, I would recommend the course to another student. The material is relevant to many disciplines.
I would absolutely recommend this course.

I would recommend this course to a student who is studying a field that provides overlap through the topic of repetition. Prof. Casetti is a dynamic professor who keeps the course interesting through anecdotes, etc.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: That requires too much writing- to explain how studying theory had a tangible effect on my work is not something I'm prepared to attempt in this box, on a course evaluation.
Repetition is the very motor of artistic production!
Without a film studies background, I worried that this course might be challenging. However, the material and seminars were adapted for a varying audience.
